name: Southernmost Hotel

reviews.text: The Sourthernmost Hotel is awesomely located right at the end of Duvall Street. You have access to three pools - each with their own atmosphere. The pool at Southernmost on the Beach is a wilder party pool, the tranquility pool in the parking lot of Southernmost Hotel is a quite get away for adults only (with servers coming around every half hour for drink and food orders) and the Pineapple Bar pool is a great family pool. Everyday at 2:00pm, servers would hand out frozen towels and popcicles. Our room was located by the Pineapple pool with a small patio. The staff is very friendly and accommidating. The room was updated. If we go back to Key West next year, this is where we will stay...again!
reviews.title: Liked it so much, I came back again this year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel. location is great , pool is beautiful. The rooms are ok , not worth $219 per night , I stayed in room 280 , no AC in the bathroom , needed updating and small bathroom, bed sheets and comforter cheap material, ceiling looked unfinished , if your going to charge $219 per night , I don't mind paying , but I want my money worth. The only reason they can get that rate is because of location , supply and demand . In my opinion the rooms aren't worth more than $130-$150 per night. On the same trip I stayed at Loews South Beach Miami for $199 per night. The pillows and comforter were made from feathers , location right on the beach. If you want a nice hotel and can afford it , stay at one of the hotels on Mallory Square and pay a little more
reviews.title: Great location, but not worth the money

reviews.text: Highly recommend for travellers to Key West who are mindful of how they spend their hard earned dollars. The Southernmost offers a very good standard of accommodation and facilities at a very reasonable price.... especially given its location. I'm sure there are cheaper Key West options as I'm sure there are better.... but probably not combined! I'm picky and I really couldn't find much to fault.... except the lack of descent self service laundry machines! But that really is it:-) It's great! nice pools, nice bar, free parkiing, fantastic location, free use of more expensive sister hotel facilities and an eclectic mix of fun activities for those too idle to go out and explore this beautiful island.
reviews.title: perfect location, lovely hotel and all at a great price!

reviews.text: Had just 1 day in Key West and spent overnight at this Hotel.
reviews.title: First time at Key West!

reviews.text: The beds were big, and I slept as an child. The pool in the morning was perfect.
reviews.title: Fun in the Sun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. We spent July 1-7th at the resort and had the best time. We stayed in room 246 and it was excellent. Only complaint is the room cleaning staff will throw away the large plastic cups you get from outside restaurants like 5 Guys, we were using them for ice water. But that is our only complaint. Make sure you go to Beer school and get PHD, we had a blast. We will definitely return!
reviews.title: Great Week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First and foremost, the staff is amazing and so very helpful and friendly. The cafe at southernmost on the beach (across the street) is great and you can't beat the view! The hotel is located at the end of Duval St.close enough to walk to most attractions but far enough away to enjoy some peace and quiet. To sum up our experience in one word, PERECT!
reviews.title: honeymooners dream!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Southernmost for a (very) belated honeymoon trip, more like the honeymoon we never got to take. We were upgraded (yay! a nice surprise) to a pool view room, and got a bottle of champagne as well (Thank you Colleen!!). Lovely place! I would highly recommend it. Our room was recently updated and quite nice, very comfy king bed, friendly staff, good location, great pool and bar. Prices were fair for KW, no hidden fees.
reviews.title: We loved the Southernmost!

reviews.text: I loved being able to use the amenities at SMOTB as well. We spent most of our time at the Pineapple Pool and Bar, but we also visited the Tranquility Pool one afternoon when the Pineapple Pool was full of kiddos. We also visited the Ocean Swimming Pier and Shores Bar and Pool at SMOTB once, as well as South Beach. It's so nice to have all that right on the resort complex. There are so many options for swimming & sunbathing!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one brunch and one dinner at the Southernmost Beach Cafe. Lovely, nice and relaxed, right on the water at South Beach. Food and service were excellent, fair prices too, especially for an oceanfront restaurant.
reviews.title: Great place, Great location!

reviews.text: Our first time in Key West and after 25 hours in the car it looked perfect for us. Very nice clean rooms, extremely comfortable beds, at the quiet end of Duval St.
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I decided on the Southernmost Hotel for our days in Key West after evaluating many resorts, rates, locations, etc. We booked a queen deluxe room, which was a room overlooking one of the parking lots (the one in front of the adult pool). The hotel is in a GREAT location at the southern end of Duval Street - very quiet but just steps away from the insanity further up Duval. We really enjoyed cooling off in the adults only pool and both days (a Saturday and Sunday), we were the only ones in the pool. Based on the parking lot, the hotel appeared to be full but it never felt crowded over at the main pool either. The room itself was very clean, and the bed was very comfy. The room was also very quiet and had the air conditioner was fantastic, which is a major bonus as the temps were over 100 with the heat index. I can't say I was blown away by this property, but I did think it was nice and would recommend it to others based on price, amenities and location.
reviews.title: Good option for Key West

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Key West and was very happy with our hotel choice.
reviews.title: Loved this resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Southernmost Hotel is part of a 4 hotel resort which you can use the facilities of the other hotels.
reviews.title: First Trip to Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by the nicest reception staff who told us where everything is and gave us a schedule of all the activities going on for the next week.
reviews.title: Great Place to Have a Wedding
Great location, service, room and pools!!!
reviews.text: This was the first time visit to Key West for my fiance and I. We picked this hotel b/c it was on Duval Street, which is where we definitely wanted to be in terms of restaurant options and nightlife. And the location did not disappoint at all!! It was a mere 10 / 15 minute walk to where the nightlife was... 20 minutes to the other end of Duval Street. Location was just perfect for what we were looking. We never used the car once in the 2 nights we stayed. The hotel is right next to its sister hotel, Southernmost on the Beach, which we had full access to the pool, private beach, and great sunning deck! We did not spend much time on the beach b/c we really loved the pool! The beach isn't the best, but we had already been told that by friends, that people do not go to Key West for the beaches. That's why having a great pool was important and the Southermost definitely had great pool options (3 pools in total to pick from!). The staff was super friendly and helpful from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. Even though we were not able to check in early, we were provided w/ a temp card for access to the pools and the bathrooms to change into our bathing suits. The room was clean and quiet. It had a safe right in the room and also a mini fridge, which was a great touch. Overall, our experience at the Southermost Hotel was great and we can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First timers to Key West and we had an absolutely wonderful time! We were there from 5/24 - 5/28 and had temps in the mid-80's with just one hour of rain! The Southernmost lived up to its billing as one of the best resorts in Key West! The staff was great! Upon our arrival we were greeted with a card and a bottle of champagne in our room. The two staff members that really stood out were Boomer and Louie! Boomer did a nice job of running the pool activities as well as taking us out snorkeling just off the pier of the resort! Saw sharks (nurse), a barracuda, starfish and countess fish! And the best part was it was free of charge! Louie did a great job keeping the pool deck clean! I met him on Friday morning briefly as he sold me a hat. On Monday, before we left I ran into him again and he remembered me by name!! Considering the amount of people he came across daily, I was truly impressed with this display of hospitality. The resort's restaurant had an excellent happy hour with very tasty hors d'oeuvres. Key West has excellent restaurants as well as their nightlife! Had fantastic meals at Blue Heaven and El Siboney. Rented a tandem bike from the resort and had fun checking out the island!! The north end harbor had a ton to offer as well! Couldn't do it all but that's why we'll plan a return trip!!
reviews.title: Twentymoon

reviews.text: First time in Key West. This place made the trip most enjoyable. In Miami for Marlins game with the (teenage) kids. Planned to stay one night in Key West. Had no reservation - we stumbled upon this wonderful place. Decided to stay and additional night after the first was so enjoyable. "Sweet" is how the kids described it. Of course this was after the dive we stayed in Miami.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay in Key West.

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in April 2010 (Although I could only choose as far back as July 2011) on the site
reviews.title: 1st Time in Key West-Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Great Location Right off the End of Duval Street
reviews.title: Awesome key west hotel

description: Southernmost Hotel in the USA located on the world famous Duval Street and steps from the beach. 118 Guest Rooms, the Pineapple Pool and Bar, an adult only tranquility pool, poolside conference room, fitness center, spa services, and concierge. A member of the Southernmost Hotel Collection. Additional resort amenities include access to junior size olympic pool at Southernmost on the Beach, private tanninig pier, tanning beach and on-site activities. Come experience true luxury on Duval Street at the all new modern Southernmost Hotel. Stay in one of our freshly remodeled rooms that reflect the touch of Caribbean elegance you have been longing for. Bask in the sunshine at either of two newly refashioned pool areas. And, still be pampered with the amenities Southernmost Hotel has made its standard. The Southernmost Hotel – where stylish sophistication meets simple satisfaction.
